summary: the ideal hosts of -CoV and -CoV are mammals, and -CoV primarily infects birds, while -CoV has been identified in both mammals and birds (3). in the past 15 years, there have been two epidemics of fatal pneumonia. nsp9 is a nucleic acid binding protein that is essential for replication. the dimerization of nsp9 is critical for viral replication. nsp9 is a nucleic acid binding protein that is essential for replication. data collection and refinement statistics Parameter Value(s)a Wild-type PDCoV nsp9 PDCoV nsp9-N7 Wild-type PEDV nsp9-N7 Wild-type PEDV nsp9-C59A Data collection Space group P21 P21 P64 P43212 Cell parameters (a,b, c, 57.97, 55.19, 69.44 31.55, 83.86, 36.34 atoms 2,970 1,463 1,498 2,249 No. of solvent atoms 207 70 0 0 No. of molecules 4 2 2 3 RMSD Bond length (°) 0.007 0.009 0.009 0.005 Bond angle (°) 1.018 1.070 1.577 1.348 Avg B factor (2) 33 20 109 103 Ramachandran plot: core, allow, disallow (%) 97.29, 2.71, 0.00 97.81 the dimer interface is formed by the N-fingers and the parallel association of the C-terminal -helices. a total surface area of 924.3 2 is buried upon dimerization. a total surface area of 924.3 2 is buried upon dimerization. the interacting residues between subunits A (blue) and B (magenta) were determined using LIGPLOT. the calculated molecular weight of the PDCoV nsp9 peaks was determined by fitting to the calibration curve. the molecular mass represented by each major peak is indicated. UC experiments to confirm oligomeric state of PDCoV nsp9 in solution. nsp9-N7 mutant eluted in two peaks with calculated molecular masses of 12.64 and 25.33 kDa, corresponding to a monomer and a dimer. nsp9-N7 protein was prepared, and SEC and AUC assays were used to analyze the oligomeric states of the two mutants. the structural superposition of the wild-type nsp9 monomer shows a root mean square deviation (RMSD) of 0.9 between the 90 C atoms. the nsp9-G96E and nsp9-G100E mutants have a monomeric form. the nsp9-WT and PDCoV nsp9-N7 monomers are colored orange and blue. the results reveal that leu4 and Leu6 are not important amino acids for nucleic acid binding. the wild-type PDCoV nsp9 protein bound to ssDNA with a Kd of 410 M. the single-stranded DNA binding affinities of the nsp9-R7A, nsp9-G96E, and nsp9-G100E mutants are 2.55-fold weaker than that of wild-type each protein was assayed at different concentrations (0, 25, and 50 M) with 5 M 5′-Cy5-labeled 36-mer ssDNA. each protein was assayed in 2-fold concentration steps with 10 nM 5′-Cy5-labeled 36-mer ssDNA. the distance between the two Gly102 residues is 10.3, with a very weak hydrophobic interaction. compared with PDCoV nsp9, the N-finger of PEDV nsp9 may be flexible and cannot be built in the model. two -strands, 4 and 5, are also involved in dimerization through the formation of two hydrogen bonds between the Cys59 side chain and the main chain of residue 61. two H-bonds between the asn60 main chain and the side chain of residue 61, and hydrophobic interactions among residues Lys52, Gly58, Cys59, asn60, and Thr61. PEDV nsp9 and the nsp9-C59A mutant were treated with SDS-PAGE loading buffer without DTT, a reagent that can disrupt the intramolecular or intermolecular disulfide bond formed by cysteines. the results show that the PEDV nsp9 dimer is monomer in cells. the crystal structure of the nsp9-C59A mutant monomer shows 7 -strands and an -helix appended at the C terminus. the structural superposition of the wild-type nsp9 monomer yields 94 C atoms with an RMSD of 0.2. the disulfide-linked homodimer is the primary form of the PEDV nsp9 dimer. nsp9-C59A/G95E/G99E/G102E mutant shows very weak binding affinity. the nsp9-C59A mutant shows a 2.7-fold reduction in ssDNA binding. the nsp9-C59A mutant shows a 14-fold reduction. the nsp9-C59A mutant shows a 14-fold reduction. nsp9-WT, nsp9-C59A, PEDV nsp9 and PEDV nsp9-C59A monomeric structures are superimposable. another dimer of PEDV nsp9 forms a disulfide-linked homodimer. two -strands, 4 and 5, are also involved in dimerization. PEDV nsp9 and the nsp9-C59A mutant were treated with SDS-PAGE loading buffer without DTT, a reagent that can disrupt the intramolecular or intermolecular disulfide bond formed by cysteines. the structure is determined by molecular replacement and refined to a 3.0- resolution. nsp9-C59A mutant monomer also shows 7 -strands and an -helix appended at the C terminus. nsp9-C59A mutant monomer yields 94 C atoms with an RMSD of 0.2. the results show that the wild-type PEDV nsp9 protein bound to ssDNA with a Kd of 145 M shows a 2.7-fold reduction in ssDNA binding. the nsp9-C59A mutant shows a 14-fold reduction, and the nsp9-C59A/G99E/G102E mutant shows much weaker binding affinity. the association of nsp9-WT, nsp9-C59A, and nsp9-C59A/G95E/G99E/G102E with 36-mer ssDNA was measured by MST assays. each protein was assayed in 2-fold concentration steps with 10 nM 5′-Cy5-labeled 36-mer ssDNA. each protein was assayed in 2-fold concentration steps with 10 nsp9-K10A, nsp9-R68A/K69A, and nsp9-R106A mutants show slightly weaker ssDNA binding activity. nsp9-K10A and nsp9-R106A mutants have 1.3- and 2.7-fold reductions in ssDNA binding affinity compared to the wild-type protein. the nsp9-K10A/R68A/K each protein was assayed at different concentrations (0, 0.41, 0.82, 1.64, 3.28, 6.56, and 10 M) each protein was used in 2-fold concentration steps with 10 nM 5′-Cy5-labeled 36-mer ssDNA. each protein was used in 2-fold concentration steps with 10 nM 5′-Cy5-labeled ssDNA. PDCoV nsp9-N7 mutant is monomeric in solution, which is consistent with wild-type PDCoV nsp9-N7. the N and C termini of the protein are more conserved than the central core region. in other proteins, mutation of the Gly residues in the motif led to the decreased or the complete loss of dimerization of transmembrane helices. disulfide bonds are rare in the cytoplasm of the infected cell (29) the biological function of the disulfide bond should be further investigated by a reverse genetics system. a previous study suggested that the dimer of PDCoV nsp9 may be critical for viral replication. nsp9-K10A, nsp9-R68A/K69A, and nsp9-R106A mutants mildly affect ssDNA binding activity. nsp9-K10A/R68A/K69A/R106A mutant reveals significant reduction in ssDNA binding activity. nsp9 is able to bind ssDNA or ssRNA (22, 25), although binding of ssRNA is expected to be the native function. nsp9 may not have a specific binding sequence but act in conjunction with other nsp's as a processivity factor (21) in the emerging CoV PDCoV, we first confirm that the N-finger motif is critical for dimerization. the dimerization of PDCoV nsp9 is also supported by the parallel association of the C-terminal -helix via strong hydrophobic interactions. for the SARS-CoV nsp9 protein, the N-terminal extended chain and the C-terminal -helices stabilize its interface. PDCoV nsp9 n7 without the N-finger forms the monomeric stage. the n-finger motif and the GXXXG motif are both important for dimerization. EMSA and MST experiments also suggest that the N-finger of PDCoV nsp9 can influence the affinity to nucleic acids. nsp9 dimerization is critical for the function of this replicase protein for the IBV infectious clone system. nsp9-Y82A mutant strongly enhances ssDNA binding affinity. nsp9 is able to bind ssDNA or ssRNA (22, 25), although binding of ssRNA is expected to be the native function. the potential site of RNA binding may provide a new insight into the binding of the replication/transcription complexes to viral RNA. most nsp9 proteins originated from ancestral coronavirus, which have N-terminal loops and GXXXG motifs. nsp9s have diverse forms of dimerization that promote their biological function. p9 protein and PEDV nsp9 protein were obtained by adding 1 mM IPTG (isopropyl--d-thiogalactopyranoside) to Luria broth. the bacteria had grown to an optical density at 600 nm of approximately 0.6 at 37°C, followed by shaking at 37°C for 4 h and 27°C for 10 h. for protein purification, the cells were harvested, resuspended with phosphate- wild-type protein crystals appeared within 40 days at 20°C in 0.1 M Tris (pH 8.5) and 25% (vol/vol) tert-butanol. the nsp9-C59A mutant protein crystals appeared within 2 days at 20°C in 0.2 M sodium thiocyanate (pH 7.7) and 10% PEG 3350. the buried surface areas between the two monomers and the RMSD were analyzed using PDBePISA (http://pdbe.org/pisa/) and PDBeFold (http://pdbe.org/pisa/) the amino acid sequences of coronavirus nsp9 were aligned using ClustalW2 (37) and visualized with the ESPript 3 server (38). eukaryotic cells were analyzed using a superdex 75 10/300GL column (GE Healthcare) with a buffer containing 20 mM Tris-HCl (pH 7.4) and 200 mM NaCl at a flow rate of 0.6 ml/min (4°C) wild-type and mutant (N7 and L4A/L6A/R7A/N8A) nsp9 proteins eluted in different fractions were analyzed by membranes were visualized using enhanced chemiluminescence system. sedimentation boundary was monitored every minute at a wavelength of 280 nm. the gel was run for 50 min with running buffer (20 mM Tris, 50 mM boric acid, 1 mM sodium EDTA [pH 8.3] at 100 mA and 4°C. after electrophoresis, the gel was fixed in 3.5% (wt/vol) -sulfosalicylic acid–10% (wt/vol) acetic acid until the dye turned yellow. nsp9 or nsp9 mutant proteins were serially diluted with buffer containing 10 mM Tris (pH 8.0) and 200 mM NaCl. then 10 nM Cy5-labeled ssDNA diluted with buffer containing 10 mM Tris (pH 8.0)–200 mM NaCl and 0.05% Tween 20 was added. thermophoresis was carried out at room temperature, 100% light-e nm of approximately 0.6 at 37°C followed by shaking at 37°C for 4 h and 27°C for 10 h respectively. PDCoV nsp9-N7, PEDV nsp9-C59A, and other nsp9 mutants were expressed and purified as described above. wild-type protein crystals appeared within 40 days at 20°C in 0.1 M Tris (pH 8.5) and 25% (vol/vol) tert-butanol. the nsp9-C59A mutant crystals were stabilized in 0.25 M sodium thiocyanate (pH 7.7), 10% PEG 3350, and 2% ethylene glycol. buried surface areas between the two monomers and the RMSD were analyzed using PDBePISA (http://pdbe.org/pisa/) and PDBeFold (http://pdbe.org/pisa/) the amino acid sequences of coronavirus nsp9 were aligned using ClustalW2 (37) and visualized with the ESPript 3 server (38). wild-type and mutant nsp9 proteins eluted in different fractions were analyzed by SDS-PAGE. hemagglutinin was cloned into pCAGGS vector using the EcoRI and XhoI restriction sites. at 48 h posttransfection, cells were treated with RIPA lysis buffer (Beyotime) membranes were washed three times for 15 min at room temperature with TBS-Tween. membranes were visualized using enhanced chemiluminescence system. sedimentation boundary was monitored every minute at wavelength of 280 nm. the gel was run for 50 min with running buffer (20 mM Tris, 50 mM boric acid, 1 mM sodium EDTA [pH 8.3] at 100 mA and 4°C. after electrophoresis, the gel was fixed in 3.5% (wt/vol) -sulfosalicylic acid–10% (wt/vol) acetic acid until the dye turned yellow. ssDNA diluted with buffer containing 10 mM Tris (pH 8.0)–200 mM NaCl and 0.05% Tween 20 was added. thermophoresis was carried out at room temperature, 100% light-emitting diode power, and 20% IR-laser power.
